method: First, calculate the mass of pure CaCO3 in the limestone sample: mass(CaCO3) = 5.00 g × 0.840 = 4.20 g. Next, convert to moles using n = m / Mr: n(CaCO3) = 4.20 g / 100.1 g mol-1 = 0.04196 mol. From the balanced equation CaCO3 + 2HCl -> CaCl2 + CO2 + H2O, the mole ratio of CaCO3 to CO2 is 1:1. Therefore n(CO2) = 0.04196 mol. Finally, calculate the mass of CO2: mass(CO2) = n × Mr = 0.04196 mol × 44.0 g mol-1 = 1.846 g, rounded to 1.85 g.
